{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3718489,"name":"Murilo Miranda Santos","username":"murilo404","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-19T14:44:02.568Z","cooked":"

Good morning everyone! My FRC team used the recently acquired Swerve to compete in the official season. However, after reviewing the matches and taking a closer look, we realized we weren’t able to achieve a full drive. So, I want to ask everyone:

What did you do to achieve a full drive?
Were there any changes that significantly impacted the drive?
How did you improve your Swerve’s drive?

We’re currently using a Swerve MK4i with NEO motors for drive and angle, and monitoring with CANcoders, as well as a Pigeon 2.0.

Thank you in advance for your help!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-08-19T14:44:02.568Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":143,"readers_count":142,"score":73.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":505439,"topic_slug":"drive-swerve-in-teleop-and-in-autonomous","display_username":"Murilo Miranda Santos","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69705,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/drive-swerve-in-teleop-and-in-autonomous/505439/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3718531,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-19T15:15:33.631Z","cooked":"

I’m not exactly sure what you mean by “full drive”. (Full speed, perhaps?)

If you’re willing to share your code in a github public repo, it’s a lot easier to help.

Alternatively (or in addition), you could take our 2025 code and run it for testing on your bot and/or sim.

You’ll need to change the IMU to the Pigeon 2.0 and the CAN IDs in deploy/swerve, but it should drive OK as we have the same hardware except for IMU, so it should serve as an easy-to-try sanity test.

I mean, driving without any errors, such as swerving, braking, and other issues. Sorry for my poor description, kkkk.

It would be useful to have a more thorough description of what exact issues you saw, or link to some of the videos with a timestamp of where the issues you see are.

That said, there’s a good chance that the answer to “how can we drive better” is “more driver practice”.

I watched a couple 9485 matches and it seems like driver practice would be helpful. My honest opinion is the robot movements and swerve movements didn’t look too bad, but that they did have some times where they were impacting the wall or reef too hard and maybe had some issues where they would overrotate when trying to score. But they were scoring enough that it didn’t seem to be a fundamental issue with the drivetrain.

They did seem to need to wait on the elevator some, which slowed their cycles.

The matches I watched didn’t have scoring autos, just drivng straight ahead. So that is an area to work on. At a basic level, you can throw pathplanner on and figure out any additional swerve tuning you might need. With vision added you may not need much to get a consistent 2 coral auto. We could calibrate the wheel diameter and the paths were pretty good after that, without much advanced swerve tuning.
